columns.text: In this problem, we will use the information of a publicly traded company to answer the given questions.

As of writing, the most recent stock price of TSLA is at $\$758.75$. The market capitalization is at $797.30$ Billion. There are currently $1.04$ billion outstanding shares. There is no current data listed for the most recent dividend. Since there is no data listed for the recent dividend, the dividend discount model cannot be used. TSLA has a beta of $2.08$. Since the beta is greater than $1$, it means that the stock price is highly volatile.
The current yield for a three-month treasury bill is valued at $1.06\%$ or $0.00106$. Th historical market risk premium is $7\%$ or $0.07$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected Return}&=0.00106+2.08 \times 0.07\\[15 pt]
&=0.14666
\end{aligned}$$

Based on the given data, the expected return os $0.14666$ or $14.666\%$
